header: We Are Appealing To You Too!

verse: And working-with Him, we also are appealing that you not receive the grace of God in vain.
For He says [in Isa 49:8], “I heard you at the acceptable time. And I helped you on the day of salvation”. Behold, now is the very-acceptable time. Behold, now is the day of salvation.

header: ... In The Process Giving Them No Opportunity For Stumbling...

verse: ... in nothing giving any opportunity-for-stumbling, in order that the ministry may not be faulted,

header: ... But Commending Ourselves While Enduring The Bad And Persevering In The Good

verse: ... but in everything, as God’s servants, commending ourselves in great endurance— in afflictions, in constraints, in distresses,
in beatings, in prisons, in disturbances, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;
in purity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in a holy spirit, in sincere love,
in the word of truth, in the power of God; through the weapons of  righteousness for the right hand and the left;
through glory and dishonor, through evil-report and good-report; as deceivers and true ones,
as being not-known and being fully-known; as dying and behold we live, as being disciplined and not being put-to-death,
as being grieved but always rejoicing; as poor but enriching many, as having nothing and holding-on-to all things.

header: Open Your Hearts To Us, Corinthians

verse: Our mouth has opened to you, Corinthians; our heart has been opened-wide.
You are not restrained in us, but you are restrained in your own deep-feelings.
Now as the same return— I speak as to my children— you also open-wide.

header: Do Not Be Mis-Yoked To Unbelievers; Be Separated Out To God Your Father

verse: Do not be ones being mis-yoked to unbelievers. For what partnership is there for righteousness and lawlessness? Or what fellowship is there for light with darkness?
And what is the harmony of Christ with Beliar? Or what share is there for a believer with an unbeliever?

And what agreement is there for the temple of God with idols? For we are the temple of the living God, just as God said [in Lev 26:12], that “I will dwell in them, and I will walk-among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people”.
Therefore, “Come out of their midst and be separated”, says the Lord, “and do not touch an unclean thing. And I will take you in
and be a father to you, and you will be sons and daughters to me”, says the Lord Almighty.
